items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message: This message has been issued because some minor flooding to riverside roads and footpaths is possible through the rest of this afternoon and evening, Monday 8th November, due to recent tide locking and continued elevated water levels.  High water levels may last for a few days, until the high tides at Great Yarmouth have passed. This is due to a natural tide locking effect. High tidal water moving up the rivers from Great Yarmouth, is currently restricting the normal drainage out to sea at low tide, of the Broads river system. We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry road in Horning. Take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We are monitoring the situation and not expecting the situation to escalate.  We will update this message by 10:00am tomorrow, Tuesday 9th November.

items.message: This flood alert is being removed as yesterdays tide was not as high as expected. Tidal levels will be falling going into next week. Following this yesterdays high tide, our operational staff are checking our flood embankments and other defences in the area. Please keep away from flood water and to report an issue relating to river, tidal or coastal flooding, call our Incident Hotline 0800 80 70 60. Be aware of your surroundings and keep up to date with the current situation via our Check for Flooding Service on Gov.UK or via Floodline 0345 988 1188.

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed due to improved weather conditions and falling tides. River and high tide levels are now below the flood risk threshold.
We will continue to monitor the situation.

items.description: Coast from Ramsgate to Kingsdown
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message: This Flood Alert has been removed. The risk of flooding along the Coast from Ramsgate to Kingsdown including the Tidal Stour has now reduced and water levels have fallen. There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. Please continue to be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and low lying roads near watercourses. Tides are now reducing, however we will continue to monitor the situation.

items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. Please continue to be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and low lying roads near watercourses. Tides are now reducing, however we will continue to monitor the situation.
